subject.topcClas: SOCIAL STRATIFICATION AND GROUPINGS - gender and gender roles

stdyInfo.abstract: Intersectional perspective underlines the fact that oppression in a society has a number of sources, which interact and overlap one another. Intersectionality is not only an academic project, but is also part of feminist activism. In this research, intersectionality is analysed in relation to student feminist societies which operate at 84 universities throughout the United Kingdom. The study was conducted by using the method of interview – talks with leading members of student feminist societies across the United Kingdom – and survey, by which we included a larger proportion of members of student feminist societies.

sumDscr.nation: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
sumDscr.geogCover: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
sumDscr.universe: Members of 84 student feminist societies in United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.

dataColl.sampProc: 1, 2) Total universe/Complete enumeration. In the first phase, student feminist societies within universities in the United Kingdom were identified (N = 84). Through websites and Facebook groups, contact information from leading members of 70 societies was collected and an invitation to participate was sent via e-mail. 7 societies responded.
3) The researcher sent an invitation to participate in the survey to all 20 closed FS Facebook groups.
dataColl.collSitu: 1) Two interviews with leading members of FS were conducted: 1 via Skype call and another in person.

2) Four questionnaires were sent in an e-mail attachment to the leading members of FS. Questionnaires were completed in the Microsoft Office Word document by respondents and sent back to the researcher.

3) The link to the survey on the Survey Planet portal was sent to all members of feminist societies within 20 Facebook groups that previously responded for co-operation. 152 respondents filled in the survey.

method.stdyClas: 4: studies of limited conceptual extent and methodological sophistication

qstn.qstnLit: Please name the Student Feminist Society you're a member of:
Which of the following best describes your gender identity?
Which of the following best describes your sexual identity?
How would you describe your family's social class status?

catgry.labl: Other:I believe in something, I'm just not sure what
Other: The way of the Jedi

qstn.qstnLit: Do you have a disability or learning difficulty?

qstn.preQTxt: Please indicate your level of agreement with the following statements
qstn.qstnLit: I identify as an intersectional feminist.
The feminist society I am a member of is intersectional.

var.name: v11
var.labl: The FS I am a member of represents a safe space.

qstn.qstnLit: The feminist society I am a member of represents a safe space for members of minorities (LGBT, class, ethnic and religious minorities, persons with disabilities).

var.name: v12
var.labl: The wave narrative is still relevant today?

qstn.qstnLit: Do you think that when discussing feminism, the 'wave narrative' (First, Second and Third-Wave Feminisms) is still relevant today?

var.name: v13
var.labl: Students FS related to third-wave feminism?

qstn.qstnLit: Have you come across Student Feminist Societies being related to third-wave feminism?
